column2: Leaking information about an exception, such as messages and stack traces, to an external user can expose implementation details that are useful to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.
column4: [["Stack trace information"|"relative:///main.py:35:25:35:25"]] flows to this location and may be exposed to an external user.

column1: Flask app is run in debug mode
column2: Running a Flask app in debug mode may allow an attacker to run arbitrary code through the Werkzeug debugger.
column4: A Flask app appears to be run in debug mode. This may allow an attacker to run arbitrary code through the debugger.

column1: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic hashing algorithm on sensitive data
column2: Using broken or weak cryptographic hashing algorithms can compromise security.
column4:
[["Sensitive data (password)"|"relative:///main.py:13:19:13:26"]] is used in a hashing algorithm (SHA256) that is insecure for password hashing, since it is not a computationally expensive hash function.
